subject: [Lab 09] Q2: Over or Under
content:
Q2: Over or Under

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q2: Over or Under in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: What do I do  Running tests  \---------------------------------------------------------------------   over-or-under > Suite 1 > Case 1  scm> (load-all ".")   # Error: unexpected end of file  Run only this test case with "python3 ok -q over_or_under --suite 1 --case 1"   \---------------------------------------------------------------------   Test summary   0 test cases passed before encountering first failed test case
I'm not sure where I am supposed to go to create my code answers. Is there a way to open the lab in visual studio code? or is it all done on git bash?

follow-ups.feedback: In a separate command prompt / terminal in the lab09 folder, run the command                python3 editor  This will open up a web-based Scheme editor that you can use to edit and test your code. Note that Ok autograder commands must be used in a separate command prompt / terminal in order to back up and submit work

threads.question: When I was trying to open the web editor, this error happened, I don't know what to do. Is there some IDE like PyCharm for us to use? Or can we find the source code files for this lab so that I can directly edit with .txt format?  ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjzuo79b0ulj1fi%2Fk2cxkb90oydr%2FTIM%E5%9B%BE%E7%89%8720191029235737.png)

follow-ups.feedback: You can directly edit lab09.scm (located in the lab09 folder) using a text editor of your choice, instead of using the provided editor. Many use Sublime Text or Atom.
@1827 contains instructions on getting Atom / Sublime working with Scheme

threads.question: For some reason when I try to unlock the tests or test the code I have for problem 2 I get this error. It was working fine last night but for some reason I am having this issue now. I have tried deleting and reinstalling the file but to no avail.![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjkimyiniet62h2%2Fk2gsnazkigl0%2Fweird_python_error.png)

follow-ups.feedback: Please help, I have the same issue and I cannot do the lab or homework.
I believe this has been resolved, please see @1888

threads.question: There's something wrong with my editor. I ran "python3 editor" and wrote all the codes correctly (it can work on this website <https://repl.it/languages/scheme>). But when I try to run it on local host:31415, all the cases fail and the dubug window displays this:                (load-all ".")  Same problem with homework 6. Can anyone help? Would really appreciate it.

follow-ups.feedback: Please make a private post with your code

threads.question: Anyone else getting a blank file when running python3 editor?

follow-ups.feedback: Hmmm, I never got that. Could you try opening up the actual `lab09.scm` file and see if there is any content in there? If not, try redownloading the project ZIP file and trying again.
